Clinical and video evidence in favour of eschewing, saluting and Trendelebourg lameness

question.title: Clinical and video evidence in favour of what lameness?
question.description: A clinical examination and diagnostic approach are required to diagnose lameness. What type of evidence is typically used to support a diagnosis of lameness?

option_a.title: Dodging
option_a.description: A common behavior exhibited by horses with lameness

option_b.title: Saluting
option_b.description: A behavior where a horse lowers its head and raises its hind legs

option_c.title: Trendelebourg
option_c.description: A gait that is often affected in horses with lameness

option_d.title: Eschewing
option_d.description: A behavior where a horse refuses to move or load

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct answer should be a single letter (e.g. A, B, C, or D)
